basic_info.description: üëã I'm Jason Wilson. My expertise are in front-end/back-end frameworks like Java, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and React.js. I have an associates degree in Electronic Systems Technology and my Software Engineering certification from the school Code Fellows. I spent the first 6 years of my career in the Air Force, working on transmitter/reciever radios using VHF(Very High Frequency)/UHF(Ultra High Frequency), ILS (systems designed for guiding pilots landing on a runway). After the military, I became a Field Service Engineer where I installed, maintained, and aided in the optomization of automated inspection camera systems that were designed to inspect products for any defects. I've always admired technology and was exceedingly curious about what kind of future our civilization will experience. I wanted to be in a field of producers, creators, and visionaries as opposed to the consumers. So I chose a field that would give me that opportunity, software engineering. I believe that with software engineering, instead of being a piece of history...I'll become a part of the future. If you enjoyed this portfolio template, please make sure to ‚≠ê the repository to make it more recognizable for other users. Looking forward to connecting with you!

projects.title: BlackJack Vibes
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
